title.narrative: 19 MICRONUTRIENT DEFICIENCY CONTROL

description.narrative: By 2017 Micronutrient deficiencies prevented through improved micronutrient supplementation interventions for women and children (both girls and boys)., which contributes to Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the nutritional status of Infants, young children and women is improved through the scale-up of integrated high impact and evidence-based nutrition interventions and improved family and community care practices with a focus on those most vulnerable.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017 Micronutrient deficiencies prevented through improved micronutrient supplementation interventions for women and children(both girls and boys).

description.narrative: In 2017 29 million children 6-59months provided with Vitamin A supplementation; 15.2 million children 12-59 months dewormed and 3.2 million pregnant women received iron folic acid. Over 8 million pregnant women were reached with iron folic acid while 657,011 children received MNP during the programme cycle. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: Percent of children 12-59 months received albendazole for deworming in last 6 months

Percent of children 6-59 months received at least 1 dose of vitamin A in last 6 months (MoV: Programme data)
Micronutrient Powder supplementation of 6-23 months piloted in 2 States with over 50% coverage and national scale up plan developed
